intro: Aphragmus bouffordii, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant is known for its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat. Aphragmus bouffordii typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or arid environments. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves.
